casebody.data:
HAIRSTON
v.
HARWARD 416A17-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. December 29, 2017 C. Douglas Maynard, Jr., Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, James M. Roane, III, Attorney at Law, John F. Bloss, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for Hairston, William (Jr.) Kent L. Hamrick, Attorney at Law, Ann C. Rowe, Attorney at Law, Winston Salem, for Harward, Ashwell Bennett (Jr.) Stephanie W. Anderson, Attorney at Law, for Erie Insurance Exchange. Sara R. Lincoln, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Humble, Robert S. (M.D.), et al.

Ann C. Ochsner, Attorney at Law, Raleigh.

Huntington M. Willis, Attorney at Law, Raleigh.

Deborah J. Bowers, Attorney at Law, Greensboro.

Andrew Pinto, Attorney at Law, Greensboro.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 22nd of December 2017 by Plaintiff:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of December 2017."

Plaintiff shall have up to and including the 9th day of February 2018 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
